title: Laksa
steps: Wrap pork belly in twine pressure cook on top of bones, mushrooms and kombu with a little water for 2 hours
Open pressure cooker and remove pork belly.
Boil with lid of and break up until broth is thick.
Strain broth
Mix miso with tahini and ground fried garlic and continue adding until broth is x2 concentrate. Season with more salt / sugar.
Store refrigerated or frozen. It will congele into a solid.
Unwrap chashu and refrigerate in a ziplock with soy sauce, salt and sugar.
Serve with mayu, wakame, egg and nori.

title: Tonkotsu Ramen with chashu
steps: Wrap pork belly in twine pressure cook on top of bones, mushrooms and kombu with a little water for 2 hours
Open pressure cooker and remove pork belly.
Boil with lid of and break up until broth is thick.
Strain broth
Mix miso with tahini and ground fried garlic and continue adding until broth is x2 concentrate. Season with more salt / sugar.
Store refrigerated or frozen. It will congele into a solid.
Unwrap chashu and refrigerate in a ziplock with soy sauce, salt and sugar.
Serve with mayu, wakame, egg and nori.

items: Pork belly / pork meat / chicken bones

title: Chinese Chilli Oil
steps: Dice and fry shallots and garlic until carremelised.
Add other ingredients with oil and heat, without burning, until combined.

title: Shrimp Oil
steps: Chop up heads and shells and try until oil is infused.
Strain and store

title: Mayu
steps: Cut garlic and fry until tan colour.
Remove ⅔  while tanned and let the rest almost blacken.

title: Ginger Scallion Oil
steps: Mince aromatics and place in heat proof bowl.
Heat oil until super hot and add pour over aromatics, stirring to cover all
Leave to cool and jar.

title: Easy Ramen
steps: Boil chopped onion and garlic sliced anchovies.
Strain and add miso, wakame, mushrooms, milk, miren (or sugar) and stock (if using).

title: Red lentil dahl
steps: Fry onion and garlic
Add tomato paste and allow to cook out.
Add cumin, pepper, salt, chilli, lentils, carrot and stock.
Boil until lentils are cooked and then partially blend.
Season to taste.
Fry garlic in ghee/butter , when browning , add cumin seeds and then chickpeas.
Serve topped with garlic butter mix and greek yoghurt.

title: Creamy-ish of Mushroom Soup
steps: Cut mushrooms in half if large, or else leave whole. Brown them with olive oil in a pan.
Add onions and garlic and sweat
Add white wine to deglaze and then some water.
Blend cashews, miso and a little soup liquid until smooth. Then add to pan.
Fry sliced garlic and add herbs at end to make oil to top the soup.
Season with black pepper.

title: Chinese Hot and Sour Soup
steps: Sweat the onion and garlic.
Add sugar, soy sauce, pepper, vinegar and MSG.
Add in fillings, water and some chilli oil.
Re-season and cook until fillings are just short of losing bite.

title: Taiwanese beef noodle soup
steps: Pressure cook the stew until the meat is tender. Season with more soy / sugar / chilli / vinegar.
Add flour to thicken sauce
Top with scallions, bok choy and noodles.

title: Corn Chowder
steps: Chop and fry leeks in butter, then add stock and blend.
Add minced garlic, chilli, corn, bay leaf, herbs (if using) and diced peeled potatoes.
After 10 minutes, add diced mushrooms, cream / milk, and pepper

title: Miso soup
steps: Don’t crowd with ingredients
Boil water with stock and chopped mushrooms
Lower heat and add wakame and tofu and top with scallions, then serve.

title: Cashew Nam Prik
steps: Pulse cashews in a food processor until pieces are no larger than ¼ inch
Pulse chiles, shallots, garlic, lime zest, and 1 tsp. salt in food processor until very finely chopped.
Heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium. Add cashews and cook, stirring often, until golden brown in most spots
Add curry paste and cook, stirring often, until slightly darkened, about 3 minutes. Add tomato paste and cook, stirring, until mixture starts to stick to bottom pot, about 2 minutes.
Add tomatoes and a splash of water and cook, scraping any browned bits that may have stuck to bottom of pot, until tomatoes are completely broken down and mixture is thickened, 7–10 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in fish sauce and lime juice. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt.

items: Doenjang - ½ cup (or sub in miso..)

title: Bread & butter pudding
steps: Butter the slices of bread and cut into triangles.
Soak triangles in mix of cream, beaten eggs, caster sugar and cinnamon.
Line a dish with the slices while adding raisins and top with more sugar and cinnamon.
Bake at 180 for 35 - 50 mins

title: Chantilly cake
steps: Mix the sponge ingredients into a batter and use two tins to bake the sponges.
Mix icing , lowing butter if needed so it doesn’t become too wet.
Layer the cakes and add the icing all over, using the berries between the layers and on top for decoration.

ingredients.group: icing (don’t allow to become too wet)

title: Banana bread
steps: Mash bananas and combine and other ingredients
bake at 180 until a chopstick comes out clean when poked through cake.

items: Greek yogurt / sour cream - ⅓ cup

title: Pancakes
steps: Beat together batter ingredients and leave to rest before frying.

title: Beef stew cobbler
steps: Chop the beef and dredge in the flour mix. Brown in batches and set aside.
Fry onion, garlic and thyme .
Deglaze the pan with wine and add beef back in.
Add stock and pressure cook for 45 mins.
Add veg and cook for 15 mins more.
For dumplings, combine butter with flour using finger tips, until breadcrumb texture.
Add salt, pepper, parsley, milk and cheese.
Roll into log and cut into 12 pieces.
Transfer stew to a deep pyrx dish (or not if dutch oven). Shred the beef and remove grizzle.
Top stew with dumpling balls and bake covered at 180 for half hour, until risen.
Remove the lid, top with more cheese  and grill until brown (15 mins) .

items: Self raising flour - 2 cups (or reg flour + 4tsp baking powder)

title: Spiced roast cauliflower with chickpeas
steps: Chop cauliflower and cover with oil. Roast in 240 oven until charred.
Add harissa to chickpeas and chopped tomatoes. Mix in cumin and cinnamon.
Add to the tray with cauliflower and continue until cauliflower is tender and tomatoes are roasted.
Serve topped with parsley and sea salt

title: Bok-choy muchim
steps: Make the ssamjang if necessary
Slice the bok choy or leave whole if small and tender
Mix with ssamjang, water and garlic and lightly cook until tender.
Top with sesame seeds

title: Glass Noodle Salad
steps: Soak and cook noodles until just soft. Drain and rinse in cold water.
Shred pepper and carrot with mandolin.
Combine everything and top with coriander and peanuts

title: Fried honey soy aubergine
steps: Dice the aubergine and salt lightly to drain liquid and season.
Coat each cube in flour, then egg, then panko
Prepare sauce by reducing honey, vinegar, soy and corn starch until consistency is like honey.
Fry cubes until golden, then cover in sauce and sprinkle with sesame seeds.

title: Tarte soleil
steps: Defrost spinach and squeeze to drain all liquid.
Mince garlic, dice onion and mix with spinach and salt/pepper/olive oil
Roll out pastry a little thinner into 2 squares. Sandwich the mix between the two sheets. Leave space around the edge to press closed the sheets.
Slice in radians from a small circle in the centre, then twist each strip.
Coat with beaten egg.
Bake for ~ half hour on 180.

title: Leeks with honey and vinegar
steps: Remove the open green part of the leeks. With the white part, slice into bite-sized length bars.
On a hot oiled pan, fry and char the bars on all sides, starting with the circular cut sides.
When cooked, drizzle with sauce to taste

title: Miso potatoes
steps: Half large potatoes and leave rest whole. Boil until tender
Fry potatoes dry on high heat until they have colour
Add butter and continues frying on lower heat. Potatoes should shrink in size.
Mix the miso, minced garlic, vinegar and some water together and add to the pan and cook for a few minutes.
Season with pepper

items: Baby potatoes - 8 (what fits in the frying pan)

title: Caesar salad
steps: Whisk the egg yolk with the garlic and mustard and slowly add the oil to form emulsion.
Add in minced anchovies, pepper , lemon and parm
Bake chunks of the bread after coating in oil and seasoning. Leave until very crunchy.
Roll the romain leaves by hand in the dressing and top with croutons

title: Caprese Salad
steps: Tomato
Basil
Mozzarella
Oil
Salt / pepper
Vinegar
Red onion (?)
Figs (?)

title: French Carrot Salad
steps: Grate the carrots and mix with the dressing

title: Smashed chickpea salad
steps: Rinse chickpeas and crush them roughly.
Dice pickles and scallions and mince garlic and mix together with chickpeas, mayonnaise, and tahini.
Garnish with coriander, paprika and olive oil.

title: Date and Almond Salad
steps: Baby Spinach (leave to sit in dressing…)
Almonds (roasted)
Croutons (bread + butter in pan)

title: Greek Salad
steps: Dice cucumber, pepper cheese and tomatoes and combine.
Finely slice red onion and add with vinegar, salt and whole olives

title: Kimchi
steps: Chop cabbage and wash
Prep carrot and radish into batons
Blend paste ingredients in processor
Prepare porridge by dissolving rice flour in a little water and adding to pan with sugar. Heat until thick and glossy
Combine everything in a bag and mix, then bottle and store

title: Mejadra
steps: Boil the lentils until cooked but still have a bite.
Cook the rice to al dente.
Slice the onions roughly and fry in batches until dehydrated and browned. No need to go too far as the fried onions are there too.
In a frying pan, add some oil and fry the cumin seeds. Lower the heat, then add the lentil, rice, onion and spices.
Combine and continue adding salt/spices to taste. Cinnamon should be less than

title: Focaccia
steps: Mix yeast, flour, honey, water and salt until fully blended (with hands).
Pour oil into a large bowl and coat dough. Cover.
Refrigerate for 1 night or skip and leave out (?).
When bubbly and doubled in size, poke with pinger and drizzle remaining oil and salt.
Bake at 230 for 20 - 30 mins.
Add onion / garlic if half way if using.

title: Cheesy Cabbage Gratin
steps: Slice cabbage into 8 wedges and roast at 180 for 45 mins until dried out and charred.
Fry garlic, shallots, thyme, cream, salt and pepper until shallot is soft. Then blend.
Arrange cabbage in a baking dish and cover with sauce. Bake for 30 mins more.
Before serving, top with cheese and grill.

items: Gruyere or other cheese to top

title: Turkish Eggs
steps: Poach the eggs. Pass through a sieve to remove watery whites, then transfer to a cup with some lemon juice before sliding into boiling, but still , water.
Heat the butter with garlic and leave until browning, then add chilli flakes and salt.
Set the eggs on top of some yoghurt and drizzle butter on top with dill and flake salt.

title: Kung Pow Cauliflower
steps: Mix 1tbsp wine, 1tbsp soy sauce and 2tsp corn starch.
Mix 1tbsp vinegar, 2tsp sugar, 2tsp hoisin, 1tsp sesame oil and 2tsp soy sauce
Cut up cauliflower and fry in wok until charred . Remove from heat and add it to the starch mix and toss
Fry pork/bacon if using with 6 dried chillies and 1tsp sichuan pepper (crushed) and remove from heat
Return cauliflower to wok, discarding excess  marinade . Cook until tender and charred.
Add in sauce mix with ¼ cup peanuts, 1 chopped scallion, 1crq ginger and 4 minced garlic.
Add in bacon and mix. Finish with more scallions and salt/pepper.

title: Stuffed peppers
steps: Dice courgette, onion, garlic and pepper and fry until almost tender.
Mix in rice, olives and feta and season.
Bake halved peppers for 15 minutes at 180
Add filling and nake for 15 minutes more.

title: Green Beans with sesame and soy
steps: Chop onion into wedges, separate slices and fry with minced garlic.
Add Green beans and continue frying, without over softening either beans or onion.
Add soy sauce and increase heat.
Remove from heat and mix with toasted sesame.

title: Dandan noodles
steps: Fry pork with seasoning , separating into fine mince, then set aside.
Roast and grind peppercorns and assemble sauce.
Add hot, wet noodles to the bowl and top with sauce and toppings. Add a little stock to the bowl.

title: Fried Quinoa
steps: Boil the quinoa until 75% cooked (still a little crunchy). Allow all the water to evaporate.
Stir-fry onions, garlic, carrot and cabbage with some salt.
Mix turmeric with soy sauce and sesame oil and add to the pan. Then add quinoa and yeast.
Fry until combined but still crisp.
Garnish with sesame seeds

title: Veg Korma
steps: Chop veg into uniform pieces. Boil the carrots and potato and then add the rest when almost done. Set aside
Fry the cumin and fenugreek seeds in a pan.
Blend the onion and garlic and add to pan with tomato sauce.
Add spices and season.
Add coconut milk and season.
Add veg and remove from heat

title: Beef Stir Fry
steps: Marinade the beef, then sear on pan and remove.
Add the veg and char, then add the sauce and re-add the beef.

title: Bibimbap
steps: Slice and lightly fry the carrots and mushrooms separately and set aside.
Fry the egg and the meat (if using) and set aside
Line the dolsot with sesame oil and then add the rice. Top with the runny fried egg circled with the veg, kimchi and some sauce.

title: Beef Stew
steps: Peel potatoes and slice in half. Cook in pressure cooker until soft, then mash with butter , cooking water and salt / pepper
Chop the beef and coat in flour. Fry at very high heat in the pot until browned.
Add chopped onion, garlic and tomato pure and sweat
Deglaze the pot with the wine and pressure cook until meat is tender
Add large chunks of celery and carrot and pressure cook until veg is just tender
Add slury of flour and water and herbs de provence until thick.

title: Pasta Salad
steps: Thinly slice carrot and onion/scallion and leave to soak with chopped tomatoes in vinegar and salt
Add pasta, mayonnaise , fish and seeds and mix

title: Chinese aubergine
steps: Slice aubergines lengthwise twice, then slice into small wedges
Fry aubergine on high heat with few tablespoons of oil until it has colour. Stop before it becomes tender.
Add sauce and finish cooking. Don’t overcook until mushy.

title: Stuffed bread fondue
steps: Fry the finely sliced onion and leek until very soft.
Add the cheeses, pepper, oregano and slices of scallion. Heat until combined
Cut the top off the bread and scoop out the inside. Fill the bread with cheese mix and bake, covered in foil, with lid on, at 250 for 20 mins.
Remove foil and bake for 10 mins more until toasted, leaving the lid off and bread from inside to toast beside the loaf.

title: Chili colorado
steps: Lightly boil the chillies in broth and then blend until smooth.
Braise the pork in  a pan to get colour and then add the garlic, cumin, bay leaf, oregano and chilli sauce.
Boil (pressure cooker?) until reduced to a thick sauce and meat is very tender.

ingredients.group: Sauce  (If adding chipotle, use 1 or 2 at most, or it will be very spicy)

title: Singapore Noodles
steps: Fry wide slices of onion until seared and scramble the egg on the side of the pan.
Add garlic, shrimp, cabbage, chicken and carrot. Spread out to allow steam to escape.
Add pre-soaked noodles with sauce and combine until thick. Don’t over cook.

title: Naan bread
steps: Mix the dough ingredients together, knead and leave to bulk ferment for about 2 hours in the fridge. Leave until doubled in size.
Prepare the garlic butter with melted butter and minced garlic heated together.
Knock dough back down and shape into flattened rounds. Fill with peshwari filling if using. Dry fry on a very hot pan .
Brush with garlic butter . Blend

title: Roasted feta
steps: Roast the feta with a drizzle of olive oil until slightly dried out.
Glaze with honey and thyme and continue for 15 minutes
Season with pepper

title: Pasta Aglio e Olio
steps: Fry thinly sliced garlic slowly in lots of oil, without browning.
Add chilli flakes and continues frying for 1-2 minutes longer
Add par-boiled pasta with pasta water into the pan and continue cooking pasta for 5 - 6 minutes until sauce thickens.
Add nutritional yeast and salt if needed.

title: Pasta alla Vodka
steps: Sweat the onions and garlic , then add the tomato paste and vodka and fry until rust colour.
Add the cream and the par boiled pasta and finish boiling in the sauce
Add the yeast, salt and pepper and serve

title: Onion Bhaji
notes: Serve with mango chutney, tamarind dip, mint raita
steps: Combine sliced rounds of onions with spices and minced garlic and ginger. Add flour and water until batter is just covering everything and is thick enough to hold together in a ball.
Deep fry and then sprinkle with chaat.

title: Fire chicken Yaki Soba
steps: Stir-fry the julienned veg
Add noodles, chicken pieces and mixture of gochujang, soy sauce and sugar
Remove from heat before overcooking the chicken.

title: Roast butternut squash pasta
steps: Roast the cubed squash, tomatoes and onions with salt and olive oil until browned.
Mince the garlic and heat in some oil, then add ⅔ of the squash and blend with tahini, salt, yeast and vinegar to taste.
Mix the pasta with the sauce and top with remaining roasted tomatoes and squash. Top with crumbled roast hazelnuts

title: Shallot / fennel tart tatin
steps: Peel shallots and slice in half (along natural division).
Melt enough butter in a cast iron pan to coat it generously and add the shallots, flat side down and caramelize on a  low heat for 30 minutes. They should cover the pan totally.
Turn the onions when browned.  When totally soft and browned, transfer to a plate to cool.
Pour the sugar into the pan and heat gently to form a caramel.
Add the shallots on top of the caramel, then the olives and chopped cheese and cover with pastry. Prick pastry to allow steam out. Tuck in at the sides and bake at 180 until brown .
Remove from over and flip onto a plate. If the pan can’t be put in the oven , transfer the caramel to a dish and follow the same steps.

items: Puff / Shortcrust - enough to cover dish
Brown sugar - enough to cover dish

title: Colcannon
steps: Peel, chop and boil the potatoes in salty water
In another pot, boil the chopped cabbage until tender
Brown the butter, then add scallions when just finishing.
Mash everything together, adding milk until consistency is right.

title: Rice Ratatouille
steps: Cut the veg into rounds (as close as possible for the peppers)
Add rice to the bottom of a baking dish with some passata, then cover with circles of veg rounds.
Add stock on top with olive oil
Cover and roast until veg and rice is soft, then uncover and grill.

title: Pork Bao
steps: Mix dough together, knead and leave to bulk ferment for 90 minutes
Beat dough back down and then roll out and cut into circles . Oil on one side and fold over.
Place rounds on squares of baking paper and leave them to prove (in the steamer) for 30 mins.
Steam for 12 minutes, then rest in the steamer for 5, then serve.

title: Avocado Sesame Rice Bowl
steps: Wash the rice three times, then add 1 ½ cups of water and leave to steep.
Cover the rice and bring to the boil, then lower heat to minimum to steam. Should take about 10 - 12 minutes
Toast seeds
Remove rice from heat, mix roughly and add salt, mirin / sugar , seeds, sliced scallions and top with avocado and soy sauce .

title: Chicken Provençal
steps: Add everything to a roasting tin. Cover and roast for 1 hour.

title: Char Siu
steps: Marinade the meat (if possible).
Slice meat in criscross to allow sauce to enter
Cover in sauce and roast for 15 minutes at 200
Turn meat and cover in more sauce and roast for another 15 minutes (x2). Don’t over cook (40 min+) or meat will be dry.

title: Shepards Pie
steps: Dice and boil potatoes, then mash with salt and butter / cream.
Brown beef and then add onion, garlic, stock and tomato paste and fry.
Add in carrots and fry until reduced and carrots are almost tender.
Add in peas, remove from heat and pour into a deep dish and cover with mash and cheese.
Bake to melt cheese.

items: Potatoes x 4 (peel and chop so they boil faster)
Tomato paste x ½ cup (less if concentrate)

title: Thai Larb
steps: Add rice to cold water in a pot and heat. When it comes to the boil, cover and lower heat and steam for 12 mins , or until done.
Fry onion, then add batons slices of veg, mince, chopped garlic, gochujang and soy sauce.
Mix to break up mince fully.
When cooked, but veg still has texture, add rice to the pan and mix.
Cut head of lettuce in half and use leaves as wraps

title: Quiche Lorraine
steps: Blind bake the pastry in a tin with weights so it doesn’t rise. Bake until just browning
Lightly fry onions and bacon, then mix in peas, eggs, cheese, cream cheese / cream and spinach.
Let it heat in the pan to kickstart the cooking, then pour into pastry, top with halved cherry tomatoes and bake for ~ hour.

items: Shortcrust pastry x 1 pack (to fit container)
Cream cheese / cream x ~ ½ cup
Cheese x few chunks for on top

title: Takoyaki
steps: Thinly slice fillings of cheese, scallions and octopus.
Mix batter and add to hot oiled takoyaki pan, just filling the holes.
Add in toppings to each hole and when slightly cooked, drizzle over more batter to cover.
Use a chopstick to flip balls until cooked, then remove and cover in mayonnaise, sauce, scallions and bonito flakes.

title: Takeaway Sesame Noodles
steps: Takeaway Sesame noodles
Boil the noodles to al dente and drain, drizzle with sesame oil.
Combine the sauce and add to the pan with noodles
Add water if needed
Add toppings.

items: Sesame Oil x 2 tbsp (or 1 unflavoured, 1 sesame)
Tahini x 2 tbsp (or more peanut butter…)
Flat rice noodles / udon  / ramen noodles / soba (?)

title: Fish Tacos
steps: Cube fish and add to milk bath, then toss in a mix of breadcrumbs and chilli and fry.
Prepare pico de gallo by finely dicing onion, tomato, garlic and coriander. Then add lemon and salt.
Prepare sauce by mixing mayonnaise, chipotle with adobe, lemon, chives and tobasco.
Mix tortilla flour with water and leave to rest, then form into pancakes and fry and leave to rest in a covered pile.
Assemble tacos and add sliced avocado on top with more coriander

items: Corn masa flour (for tortillas) (Fry then allow to soften in a pile while covered)

title: Veg Lasagna
steps: Dice veg roughly, then add to processor in batches to dice finely . Shake processor so all pieces get diced.
Add veg to pan with stock and tomato and leave to cook and reduce into a thick sauce.
Prepare bechamel in a pan by melting butter, adding salt and nutmeg, then adding flour until just thick enough to still spread out on the pan. Then add milk and stir until smooth and thick.
Par boil lasagna sheets, being careful they don’t stick together or fully cook , and leave to rest in a bowl of cold water.
Assemble in a deep baking dish with layers of sauce, bechamel and pasta.
Grate cheese on top and bake until cheese is browned.

title: Fish cakes
steps: Dice and boil potatoes, then mash and add spinach,  fish chunks, peas, butter/mayonnaise and salt / pepper to taste.
Allow to cool and then form into patties, coating each in flour and leaving to rest.
Dip each pattie into beaten egg and then breadcrumbs
Heat oil and shallow fry patties

title: Cachapa
steps: Mix cornmeal with water until it’s a watery battery consistency. Leave to soak and add more water if needed.
Flatten into thick pancake and fry with butter
Fold on pan and add in fillings
Finish with butter on top

title: Pinto Bean Chilli
steps: Dice onion and sweat in pan, adding chopped garlic after a few minutes
Add passata, adobe, chillies and beans
Season with salt / pepper
Remove from heat and finish with olive oil

title: Spicy sweet potato wedges
steps: Slice potato into wedges and stand them length ways (skin side down) on a baking tray to make use of the space to fit in as much as possible.
Brush with oil and water and season wedges with salt and pepper before roasting
When almost cooked, add cumin seeds to the tray.
Remove and allow to cool, then toss in sauce.
Blend/crush sesame seeds with salt, chilli and wakame and sprinkle on wedges

title: Seasoned egg (Ajitsuke Tamago)
steps: Poke hole in the bottom of the eggs before boiling for 6 minutes and leaving to pickle in brine.

title: Mushroom risotto
steps: In a pan, sweat the onion and garlic in the butter, on low heat.
Chop mushrooms into large chunks and add to pan with wine and stock.
When almost cooked, add cheese, chilli and pepper and more butter. Don’t allow consistency to become too thick.
Remove from heat and add olive oil.

items: Parmigiano - 50g (not too much or it’s sticky)
Veg stock  - ½ tsp of powder

title: Arroz con marisco
steps: Clean muscles and add to a pot with garlic, oil and a little water. Steam until open then remove from their shells and set aside. Reserve liquid in pot
Add prawn shells to liquid and boil lightly, adding a little more water to cover shells. Then strain.
Fry onions, then add the rice, paprika, chilli, passata and stock from pot.
When almost cooked, add chopped calamari and prawns on top to cook, then remove from heat and add muscles.
Finish with olive oil and serve with lemon and parsley

title: Spanakopita
steps: Fry scallions and add spinach to wilt
Turn off heat and add feta, ricotta, eggs, dill and pepper
On parchment paper on a baking tray, lay down a double layer of phyllo with extra extending out from all 4 sides. Add filling in centre and then fold extra back over to cover in a parcel.
Add extra crinkled phyllo on top and brush with olive oil

title: Peperonata
steps: Slice peppers roughly and fry on low heat in a covered pan with other ingredients until totally softened.
Season with salt and finish with olive oil

title: Feta paneer
steps: Toast spices on pan until fragrant
Add onions and garlic and cook until soft
Add spinach and wilt
Blend until smooth and add cubed feta

title: Melanzane di parmigiana
steps: Slice aubergines into long steaks
Steam one batch in microwave with a little water
Use a hot pan to char the other batch, adding a little water and oil so the pan makes contact with the full slice.
Combine batches in pan in a stack, interlacing with  grated cheese, breadcrumbs, salt / pepper, minced garlic and tomato sauce
Cover and lower heat to allow flavours to combine and cheese to melt

title: Ceviche
steps: Finely slice onion, puree garlic and roughly chop coriander .
Mix together with lime juice, chilli and fish and allow to sit before eating.

items: Chilli flakes / fresh chilli - to taste

title: Lentil puree
steps: Add everything to pot with a little water and heat lightly to incorporate flavours
Blend until smooth

title: Broccoli parm
steps: Slice broccoli into large flat steaks and onion into large slices
Char them on the pan in a little oil, without crowding
Lower heat and add anchovies, minced garlic and stir
Finish with cheese on top

title: Sweet and Sour Pork
steps: Prep sauce
Prep veg into wide slices
Slice pork and leave to marinade while prepping batter
Dredge pork and deep fry, leave to the side on kitchen paper
Stir fry onion and peppers, then add sauce, pineapple and pork.

title: Pasta di frutti di mare
steps: Deshell and devein  prawns and add shells to the bottom of a pot with a little oil, wine and garlic. Add cleaned muscles on top and cover to steam until muscles opened
Strain liquid from pot and reserve.
Remove muscles from shells
Half cook raw prawns and calamari lightly in pan with tomatoes and parsley
Add in pasta, seafood and chilli. Stir and add pasta water until pasta and seafood is finished cooking in a thick sauce.
Drizzle with olive oil

title: Chicken Katsu Sandwiches
steps: Thinly slice chicken into fillets
Dredge in flour mix, then egg, then breadcrumbs
Prep lettuce and sauce
Fry in batches and allow to drain on kitchen paper , then serve.

items: Chicken thigh or breast x 4 (for above^)

title: Moules Mariniere
steps: Clean muscles and add them to a put with wine, garlic, parsley and chilli.
Cook in vapor until all opened (7 mins)

title: Pad Thai
steps: Prep sauce, soak noodles and prep each topping
Cook noodles with sauce then remove from heat and add toppings

items: Wide rice noodles (soaked, not for long. Don’t overcook)

title: Pasta puttanesca
steps: Partially boil pasta.  Finish in pan with other ingredients and pasta water until covered in a thick sauce.
Finish with oil.

title: Roast Tofu
steps: Slice tofu and marinade
Roast until a little crispy
Serve on base of noodles

title: Cacio e pepe
steps: Boil spaghetti until ¾ done
In a pan, dissolve cheese in pasta water with pepper
Add pasta and stir until coated in thick sauce

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
steps: Marinade chicken (up to 24 hours)
Fry chicken pieces until charred
Prepare sauce in pan and blend. Add in spices and let reduce.

title: Sushi rice
steps: Rinse rice, drain water and then add the corresponding amount of water for boiling.
Soak for 15 minutes
Boil in a wide pot, so not layered too thick. Bring to the boil quickly and then cover and cook for 15 minutes on low/medium.
Turn off heat and without removing the lid, leave for 15 minutes
Cool in a large bowl and add sushi vinegar.

title: Yakisoba
steps: Prep onion into large slices and other veg into small pieces. Prep sauce . Soak noodles
Fry veg on hot pan to char
Add noodles with ginger, garlic and sauce. Add stock if more liquid is needed.
Finish with oil

title: Mushroom polenta
steps: Boil polenta in 1:4 (6 cups) ratio with stock
When its soft, add butter and cheese
Fry mushrooms in oil to soften
Add butter and garlic to season
Plate and finish with olive oil

title: Poke Bowl
steps: Cook rice and allow to cool
Top with selection of diced ingredients and finish with sauce

title: Shakshuka
steps: Fry diced onion and sliced pepper until soft
Add tomato sauce, spices and sugar
When reduced add eggs on top with feta and cover until eggs just cooked

items: Sugar x 1 ½ tsp (if not using fresh tomatoes)

title: Pork Gyoza
steps: Fill and fold the dumplings
Fry until browned, then turn down heat and add water to semi-boil until tender

title: Arroz con pollo
steps: Fry chicken on high heat without moving to brown.
Add onion, garlic and peppers and fry until wilted.
Add pre-soaked rice, wine, stock, tomatoes and olives and cook until rice is tender. Add liquid if needed. Don’t stir.
Finish with olive oil

title: Okonomiyaki
steps: Roughly shred cabbage
Combine everything. Add more stock if needed to get batter consistency and fry
Melt cheese on top on pan then add other toppings

title: Falafel
steps: Separately blend chickpeas, onion, parsley and coriander until coarse
Mince garlic and add to mixture with spices , salt, flour and baking powder
Deep fry a small ball to test seasoning
Fry in batches in golf ball sized balls and dry on kitchen paper
Eat immediately

title: Salmon with ginger soy dressing
steps: Add salmon to pan and fry on high heat until crisp
Lower heat, add in marinade and add greens to wilt.
Salmon fillets (fry/char to crisp skin)

title: Steak and broccoli
steps: Fry the steak on high heat to colour without over cooking. Slice and season with salt and pepper.
Slice the broccoli into chunks, including the stem and fry on high heat until slightly charred. Lower the heat and add the garlic and soy sauce.

title: Bread butter pudding*
steps: Butter the slices of bread and cut into triangles.
Soak triangles in mix of cream, beaten eggs, caster sugar and cinnamon.
Line a dish with the slices while adding raisins and top with more sugar and cinnamon.
Bake at 180 for 35 - 50 mins

title: Babka
steps: Mix dough and allow to bulk ferment (90 mins)
Roll into a large rectangle on a well floured surface
Cover with nutella and chocolate chips and roll up onto parchment paper
Chill in the fridge so it’s easier to work with
Cut the roll lengthways and plait leaving ends loose.
In a circular baking tin , line the outer rim with the plait and plait the ends together to make a circle. leave to prove for 3 hours
Prepare the glaze
Bake at 170 for 30 mins and glaze generously.

title: Cookies
steps: Beat melted butter and sugar.
Add vanilla and egg
Add flour/baking powder slowly to melted butter, while beating.
Add chocolate chips
Refrigerate for 1 hour.
Bake for 12 mins at 180c.

title: Basque Cheesecake
steps: Preheat the oven to 200c.
Line a greased tall circular baking tin (preferably quick release) with two squares of baking paper, crimping and allowing paper to extend above the rim to support cake when it expands.
Beat the sugar and cream cheese until smooth .
Add eggs, vanilla, salt and cream.
Gently add in the sifted flour.
Pour into the dish and bake for ~1hr.
Let cool completely before serving/removing from the tin.

title: Blueberry-ginger buckle cake
steps: Make the crumbs by mashing everything together.
Mix salt, baking powder, baking soda and flour together
Cream the butter with the sugar and ginger
Add in eggs, cream cheese (warm, to fold in easily) and vanilla
Add blueberries (defrosted) and fold in dry ingredients.
Add to buttered  baking tin lined with two sheets of parchment
Top with crumbs
Bake at 180 for about an hour

items: Salt - ¼  tsp (or none if butter is salted)

title: Marmalade Cake
steps: Deseed and blend oranges in puree.
Separate eggs.
Whisk yokes together with half the sugar, almonds, honey and salt.
Whisk the whites with the other half of sugar to stiff peaks.
Fold mixes together.
Bake at 170 (fan) for 45 - 55 min in a parchment lined 8 inch spring tin.
Make glaze with juice of two oranges and juice of lemon. Boil with 1 tbsp of sugar and cardamom until thick (or use marmalade! ).
Check the cake with a skewer and remove from the oven. Strain the glaze and spread on the cake.
Leave to cool

title: Lemon Pavlova
steps: Whisk egg yokes and sugar until stiff peaks.
Spread onto a baking tray in a 23cm circle.
Preheat oven to 180 and lower to 150 when adding pavlova.
Bake for 1 hour.
Leave to cool in the oven.
Top with cream and curd

title: Lemon curd
steps: Mix juice, zest, sugar and butter on bain marie.
Melt together and add yokes
Heat well and whisk until jelly-like

title: Mutabal
steps: Blacken aubergines on hob, then scoop out the meat.
If needed, microwave and allow to cool until liquid has evaporated, so dip doesn’t turn out watery.
Combine aubergine with minced garlic, tahini and yogurt.
Wait until cool and then season.
Leave to cool before seasoning

title: Red pesto
steps: Combine tomatoes and oil in a processor.
Allow to blend fully then add in toasted almonds and blend.
Add in finely grated cheese and minced garlic and blend, or mix with a spoon if too dry.

title: Tamarind dip
steps: Boil the tamarind in a small amount of water and add in other ingredients until thick and glossy
Strain through a sieve

title: Romesco
steps: Char peppers on the hob or pan and toast nuts. If using hazelnuts, remove from skin after toasting.
Add chopped pepper, nuts, oil, garlic and seasoning to a bowl and blend.

items: Hazelnuts (75g) (toasted) (⅔ cup nuts in total) (remove skins before adding)
Red wine vinegar x ⅛ cup (60ml)

title: Ramen Noodles
steps: Mix water and kansui.
Add flour to blender with liquid and pulse until course grain
Bring the dough together into a ball, wrap and rest for up to 1 day
Roll out in a pasta roller and cut. Dust with corn starch/rice flour

title: Thai fish curry
steps: Fry the onion and garlic with the curry paste, turmeric and coriander
Add the peppers and 1/2 the coconut milk. Simmer until peppers are cooked
Season with sugar and fish sauce
Slice the fish into chunks and lay on top of curry to lightly poach. Don't overcook
Remove from heat. Add the peas and remaining coconut milk and season again.

title: Sticky Toffee Pudding
steps: Preheat the oven to 180C/160C Fan/Gas 4 and lightly grease your dish.
Put the chopped dates, boiling water and bicarbonate of soda into a bowl, stir and then leave for 10 minutes.

Cream the butter and black treacle together in a stand mixer until well mixed, then add the sugar and mix again, beating out any lumps. Beat in an egg and keep beating – scraping down as necessary – until completely incorporated, then do the same with the other egg. Beating more gently, add the flour and baking powder until you have a smooth, thick batter.
Using a fork, stir the soaked dates, squishing them a bit, then pour the dates and their liquid into the batter and beat gently to mix in.
Pour and scrape into your prepared dish or cake tin and bake for 30–35 minutes, or until a cake tester comes out clean.

Meanwhile, to make the sauce, melt the butter, muscovado sugar and treacle over a very low heat in a heavy-based saucepan. Once the butter’s melted, stir gently until everything else is melted too. Now stir in the cream, then turn up the heat and when it’s bubbling and hot, take it off the heat.

As soon as it’s out of the oven, prick the cooked sponge pudding all over with a cocktail stick and pour about a quarter of the warm sauce over, easing it to the edges with a spatula so that the sponge is entirely topped with a thick sticky glaze. Put a lid on the remaining sauce in the pan to keep it warm.
Leave the pudding to stand for 20–30 minutes, then take to the table, with the rest of the sauce in a jug, and cream to serve.

items: Unsalted butter, softened, plus more for greasing - 75g

title: Pad See Ew
steps: Prep - Chop the veg, soak the noodles, thinly slice and marinade the beef, mix the sauce
Sear the beef on the pan. Remove and set aside
Scramble the eggs on the pan , remove and set aside
Add green to pan and char lightlys, then add noddles and more oil. Allow the noodles to char.
Add in sauce and beef
Re-season if needed

title: Tiramisu
steps: Using an electric mix the egg yolks and 1/4 cup of sugar until very pale yellow and about tripled in volume. A slight ribbon should should hold in the mix. Transfer mixture to a large bowl

Whip cream and remaining 1/4 cup sugar until it creates soft-medium peaks. Add mascarpone and continue to whip until it creates a soft, spreadable mixture with medium peaks. Gently fold the mascarpone mixture into the sweetened egg yolks until combined.
Combine espresso and rum in a shallow bowl and set aside.
Using a sifter, dust the bottom of a 2-quart baking dish (an 8x8-inch dish, or a 9-inch round cake pan would also work here) with 1 tablespoon cocoa powder.

Working one at a time, quickly dip each ladyfinger into the espresso mixture -- they are quite porous and will fall apart if left in the liquid too long -- and place them rounded side up at the bottom of the baking dish. Repeat, using half the ladyfingers, until you’ve got an even layer, breaking the ladyfingers in half as needed to fill in any obvious gaps (a little space in between is O.K.). Spread half the mascarpone mixture onto the ladyfingers in one even layer. Repeat with remaining espresso-dipped ladyfingers and mascarpone mixture.
Dust top layer with remaining tablespoon of cocoa powder. Top with shaved or finely grated chocolate, if desired.
Cover with plastic wrap and let chill in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours (if you can wait 24 hours, all the better) before slicing or scooping to serve.

title: Cheese Pasta
steps: Fry the garlic in olive oil
Remove garlic from the pan (or move to the side of the pan).
Melt butter in the pan, then add enough flour to stifen into a loose dough consistancy. Cook until tan, then add milk to form roux
Reincorporate garlic
Add in grated cheese and stir to make smooth sauce
Add in almost-done pasta with some pasta water and stir until coated. Continue until sauce is thickened.
Serve with black pepper

title: Roast Carrots with Orange and Coconut
steps: Slice the carrots lengthways if they're thick. Cover in oil and salt and roast
For the sauce, dissolve sugar in orange juice in a pot. Add in dessecated coconut
Transfer sauce to a cup and add tahini and vinegar
To serve, lay carrots on top of sauce on a platter and top with sliced red onion, coconut shavings (?) and orange zest

items: Dessecated coconut, or strined coconut cream from can
